definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Most people come to Toastmasters to overcome their fear of public speaking.
sentences.chinese: 许多人到宴会主持人之家来克服他们害怕演说的问题。

sentences.english: I received an invitation to her birthday party.
sentences.chinese: 我收到了她生日宴会的请贴。
必定来出席我的寿辰宴会。

sentences.english: At a Chinese party the guests usually arrive 5-10 minutes early.
sentences.chinese: 中餐宴会客人凡是提前五至非常钟到达。

sentences.english: The poor priest was plied with drink at a dinner party.
sentences.chinese: 宴会上不断有人给可怜的牧师灌酒。

sentences.english: Their reception, including dinner and dancing, also was held there.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚宴，包括宴会与舞会，也是在殡仪馆举行。

sentences.english: He gorged himself at the party.
sentences.chinese: 在宴会上他狼吞虎咽地把自己塞饱。

sentences.english: I need get dolled up for the party.
sentences.chinese: 参加宴会，当然要好好打扮。

sentences.english: In the evening, Speaker Mami held a welcome banquet for Chairman Wu.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，马米议长为吴邦国委员长举行了欢迎宴会。

sentences.english: At the banquet table, I had the good fortune to sit vis-a-vis an old school chum.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸和一位昔日的老校友坐在宴会桌的对面。

sentences.english: Charger plate etiquette and use varies among caterers and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 餐位盘礼节和用途在承办宴会者和餐馆之间变化。

sentences.english: Also, you have to make a charitable contribution to gain entry to these types of parties.
sentences.chinese: 而且，你还得慷慨解囊，方能参加这种慈善宴会。

sentences.english: They commemorated their victories with a grand banquet.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行盛大宴会庆祝胜利。

sentences.english: The notables then went away, and on the third day they all came with shaved heads.
sentences.chinese: 宴会散了，可第三天那些名人显贵都剃了光头来赴宴。

sentences.english: One day, God will hold the banquet community.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，神界将举办宴会。

sentences.english: So it’s to be announced tomorrow night at the supper intermission .
sentences.chinese: 所以决定明天晚上在宴会上宣布。

definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
